paper_title.ja: 透水型枠工法による寒冷地コンクリートのスケーリング抵抗性について

publication_name.ja: セメント・コンクリート論文集

paper_title.en: Study on the quality of fragile surface layer of concrete by the thickness of member section

description.en: The surface layer of concrete has a barrier performance for penetration of some substances into concrete, it is important to examine the quality of surface concrete and the influence of its characteristics on hardened concrete. It is well known that the fragile layer of concrete surface is formed due to bleeding. The fragile layer of concrete surface indicates lower strength and resistance of penetration of some substances compared with internal part of concrete, and it is thought that its thickness affects the durability of concrete. The fragile layer of concrete surface is not only formed at upper part of mold but also formed at side part of mold. And it is thought that the thickness of fragile layer of concrete surface at side part of mold vary with the member thickness. The objective of this study is to examine the influence of fragile layer on some properties of hardened concrete.

publication_name.en: LIFE-CYCLE OF STRUCTURAL SYSTEMS: DESIGN, ASSESSMENT, MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT

paper_title.en: On a new in-situ test method for permeability of concrete

description.en: The applicability o f new in -situ te sting method for permeability with regard to the durability of concrete structures, of which original concept has been proposed by authors, is examined from experiments and its extension is examined based on the diffusion theory. In the experiments, the rapid permeability coefficient defined by authors was measured in the various conditions of water cement ratio, moisture content and curing period. The higher the water cement ratio and the less the moisture content, the higher the rapid permeability coefficient. Then, the coefficient of variation in test was ranged from 15% to 30%. The analytical study showed that the diffusivity in pressure diffusion equation, being assumed as two dimensional pressure flow from the wall of a test hole, corresponded well to the change of water cement ratio and the moisture condition within the range of diffusivity obtained by conventional permeability test. In conclusion, this method was judged promising for the in-situ permeability test.

publication_name.en: Durability of Building Materials and Components 7

paper_title.ja: 吸引鐘を用いたコンクリートの簡易透気試験法に関する基礎的検討とスケーリング抵抗性評価への適用の試み
paper_title.en: Examination of rapid air permeability test which used vacuum chamber and applicability to scaling evaluation for concrete

description.en: Rapid air permeability test using vacuum chamber was examined in testing conditions and the validity as the evaluation method of scaling resistance. The testing condition of rapid air permeability test was decided based on the outcome of an experiment. For the rapid air permeability test, the sealing width of 60mm was secured around the chamber and a distance of 150 mm was secured fromthe specimen edge to the center of the chamber. These test conditions reduced the coefficient of variation to 15% in the air permeability test. Rapid air permeability factor was found to be in good compatibility with Torrent air permeability factor. Also, this factor was found to be compatible with the amount of scaling by the ASTM C672 method. As a result, the usefulness of the rapid air permeability test method was proven.

publication_name.ja: コンクリート工学論文集

paper_title.en: INFLUENCE OF FREEZING- THAWING ACTION ON CHLORIDE PENETRATION INTO CONCRETE

description.en: One of the most important problems for the concrete structure is combined deterioration. Many studies examined the deterioration that combined chloride penetration and freezing thawing action. However many studies of there were to examine the influence of chloride ion for freezing and thawing damage, a few study have been made so far for the influence of freezing and thawing environment for the chloride penetration into concrete. The objective of this study is to examine the influence of temperature condition for the chloride penetration into concrete. From the result, it was found that the chloride ion concentration of concrete exposed to freezing-thawing condition was higher compared with that exposed to constant temperature.

paper_title.en: Improvement in concrete performance and durability using permeable sheet

publication_name.en: ADVANCES IN CONCRETE TECHNOLOGY

paper_title.en: Assessment of Frost Damage of Concrete and its Repair Technique

description.en: The deterioration caused by freeze-thaw action seems to develop gradually from the surface to the inner part. When the frost damage is limited in the cover, the weakened portion is chipped off and the recovering is made by using some repairing material. In this case, it is very important to make a perfect removal of the weakened portion, but its thickness is usually determined empirically by the chipping force and so on. In this study, experimental investigations were made on the assessing technique to the thickness of damage portion and on the performance of repairing materials to bond tightly on the concrete surface and to protect it from the frost damage. The degree of damage at different levels of depth was assessed fairly well from the mechanical degradation by applying the improved pull-off test method. The rebound number and depth of pin penetration could be also used as its measure. The rapid air permeability and water absorption tests were useful for getting the information on the changes of air and water tightness caused by the deterioration due to freeze-thaw action. By using two kinds of repairing material in nine different repairing procedures, the performance after repair was examined to evaluate the refraining effect from suffering the subsequent damage. Furthermore, four types of surface coating material were examined and their ability to prevent the freeze-thaw damage was experimentally confirmed. © 1994, The Society of Materials Science, Japan. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Journal of the Society of Materials Science, Japan

paper_title.en: Assessment of Frost Damage of Concrete and its Repair Technique

description.en: The deterioration caused by freeze-thaw action seems to develop gradually from the surface to the inner part. When the frost damage is limited in the cover, the weakened portion is chipped off and the recovering is made by using some repairing material. In this case, it is very important to make a perfect removal of the weakened portion, but its thickness is usually determined empirically by the chipping force and so on. In this study, experimental investigations were made on the assessing technique to the thickness of damage portion and on the performance of repairing materials to bond tightly on the concrete surface and to protect it from the frost damage. The degree of damage at different levels of depth was assessed fairly well from the mechanical degradation by applying the improved pull-off test method. The rebound number and depth of pin penetration could be also used as its measure. The rapid air permeability and water absorption tests were useful for getting the information on the changes of air and water tightness caused by the deterioration due to freeze-thaw action. By using two kinds of repairing material in nine different repairing procedures, the performance after repair was examined to evaluate the refraining effect from suffering the subsequent damage. Furthermore, four types of surface coating material were examined and their ability to prevent the freeze-thaw damage was experimentally confirmed. © 1994, The Society of Materials Science, Japan. paper_title.en: Self compactability of fresh concrete with non-ferrous metal slag fine aggregates

description.en: The purpose of this study is to investigate the self compactability of fresh concretes with ferronickel slag fine aggregates and copper slag fine aggregates, standardized as fine aggregates for concrete in JIS A 5011. In this paper, the self compactability of fresh concretes with these slag fine aggregates, in the both cases using a limestone powder and viscosity agent, were investigated by means of the slump-flow test, the V-type funnel test, and filling vessel test. Properties of fresh concrete were studied by bleeding test and setting properties test. The rheology properties of fresh self compacting concretes with these slag fine aggregates were also investigated using the rotation viscometer. As a result, it was confirmed that the self compacting concretes could be attained even with these non-ferrous metal slag fine aggregates, in both cases using a lime stone powder and viscosity agent.
